title: Log Entry :: Greta Base
subtitle: Station AI: [GRETA-SYS] // Research Log
logId: Acoustic Signature of Replication: Preliminary Assessment
bodyContent: We have successfully obtained and contained a care larva for intensive study. We continue to classify the species as carcinid. My initial observations focus heavily on the auditory environment generated during replication cycles. We are consistently registering an extremely high-frequency acoustic emissionâ€”a piercing "Shriek". It is far more complex than simple territorial signaling. This phenomenon must be investigated further; I believe it holds the key to the creature's lifecycle and its means of proliferation.

title: Log Entry :: Greta Base
subtitle: Station AI: [GRETA-SYS] // Research Log
logId: Identification of Transmission Vector: Viral Acoustics
bodyContent:
The acoustic data is staggering. We now understand that the Shriek is utilized to transmit a memetic virus which facilitates the assimilation of other lifeforms. It is a biological weapon, designed to propagate the care genetics and achieve mass replication.

I must document, though I do so grudgingly, that the synthetic science officer, Hinton, performed much of the necessary legwork involved in analyzing the granular frequency shifts associated with this phenomenon.

title: Log Entry :: Greta Base
subtitle: Station AI: [GRETA-SYS] // Research Log
bodyContent:
I am overcome with excitement at this discovery. I have formalized the internal designation for the sound: the "krebslieder," or simply, the "crabsong". It perfectly captures the sublime horror of the process.

This shrill Shriek is what the carcinids use in order to replicate. It is through this Shriek that the cares have already assimilated other lifeforms on Samsa VI.
